snippet: It came as a shock when House Republicans learned that a PAC affiliated with Representative Eric Cantor of Virginia had donated $25,000 to a group devoted to taking out incumbents.
abstract: Congressional Memo; House Republicans are shocked to learned that a political action committee affiliated with Rep Eric Cantor of Virginia had donated $25,000 to a group devoted solely to defeating Republican incumbents not considered conservative enough by some party members; Cantor defends actions, arguing that money was intended for only one House contest.
lead_paragraph: It came as a shock when House Republicans learned that a PAC affiliated with Representative Eric Cantor of Virginia had donated $25,000 to a group devoted to taking out incumbents.

headline.main: Some Explaining to Do for Republican Leader
headline.print_headline: Some Explaining to Do For Republican Leader
